These opportunities include, but are not limited to, guest speakers and lecturers, field trips to Intelligence agencies, movie nights, and networking and career opportunities

title: Interfraternity Council
desc: The Interfraternity Council is a league of 15 Fraternities on Mason's campus, all of which are committed to excellence, scholarship and community service, with the sole intention of becoming exemplary men, students and citizens.

title: International Council of Systems Engineering
desc: The mission is to foster the definition, understanding, and practice of the world class systems engineering in industry, academia, and government

title: International Friendship Connection
desc: International Friendship Connection is an organization designed to bridge the divide between international and domestic students through social activities and events. This is done primarily through IFC Hangouts, a weekly event held at the Global Center intended to promote repeated interaction between international and domestic students that may not otherwise interact with each other. In addition to our weekly meetings, IFC hosts numerous events around the Washington Metropolitan Area intended to give both international and domestic students a chance to interact in a social environment through their shared experience in a fun and stress-free setting.

title: International Student Community
desc: The mission of ISC is to glorify God by welcoming and serving students from all nations; exploring the way of Jesus Christ with students who are interested; and equipping those students who want to serve Jesus Christ in building His global kingdom.

title: International Youth Fellowship
desc: The IYF wishes to cultivate future leaders with strong and humble mindsets.Through activities and programs such as world camps, bible study sessions, and overseas field experience, students can receive a comprehensive training.

title: Inventors and Innovations Team
desc: The mission of the Inventors and Innovations Team (IIT) is to connect like-minded students to express their interests in engineering and technology, to actively build and bring their ideas to reality. The focus is to give students the chance to develop their technical skills through hands-on construction of devices. IIT wishes to create an environment where all student ideas are accepted.

title: InvestinYOUth Mentorship Program at Mason
desc: The InvestinYOUth Mentorship program endeavors to foster public-private partnerships, utilize pre-existing resources, and recruit accomplished George Mason University mentors to inspire, advise, and build meaningful relationships with Fairfax County Public School (FCPS) students toward the goal of promoting accessibility of opportunity for all youth within FCPS and encourage higher graduation rates by overcoming social, economic, or linguistic challenges a student may face.

title: Investment Club of George Mason
desc: The purpose of the Club is to learn about the financial markets, be afforded the opportunity to improve professional credibility, share mutual interest in investing philosophies amongst members as well as with the George Mason community

title: Iota Nu Delta Fraternity, Inc.
desc: We are the George Mason Colony of Iota Nu Delta Fraternity, Inc., the world's FIRST South Asian interest fraternity.Iota Nu Delta uplifts its men in their duties: to serve, to lead, and to accomplish greater things in life.Bound by Brotherhood Eternal, we shall:1.Cultivate lifelong academic and professional excellence.2.Extend meaningful service to humanity and leadership in society.3.Promote understanding of the diverse South Asian cultures. Established at George Mason University on April 23rd, 2017.

title: Iranian Students Union
desc: Iranian Students Union is non-religious, non-political organization. It shall be the purpose of the union to facilitate the betterment of the George Mason University by promoting and fostering the aims and goals of the student and alumnus members of the George Mason University by means of the institution of such action as is appropriate to establish better educational conditions and an atmosphere of professionalism among the students and community of the George Mason university.

title: Irish Dance Club
desc: This organization is going to work towards uniting Irish dancers at George Mason University to practice together, perform at Geroge Mason University together, and to expose members to the sport of Irish dance. This will include attending competitions or professional dance company performances, and more. The organization will raise money for competitions, majors (regionals, nationals, and worlds), and to attend professional performances.

title: Israel Student Association
desc: The Israel Student Association is a cultural organization that seeks to educate the student body about Israel. We hope to create an environment that fosters healthy dialogue and discussion through educational and intercultural programming. People of all backgrounds and religions are encouraged to join us!

title: iTutor
desc: The purpose of this organization is to make tutoring more accessible to underrepresented families and their kids in the area. iTutor will reach out to schools that need our help, we will connect with classes or individual students, and tutor them as need be.

title: Japanese Student Association
desc: Our mission is to promote interest in the society, language, and culture of Japan among members of the university community.

title: Journal of Mason Graduate Research
desc: The Journal of Mason Graduate Research (JMGR) is committed to providing George Mason University (Mason) and the broader academic community a sustainable, quality peer reviewed, open access journal of graduate and joint graduate/faculty research. In addition, it provides Mason graduate (Masters, Doctoral, and Professional) students opportunities to engage in positive collaborative leadership through the peer review and publication processes, as well as Mason faculty opportunities for service to the university through academic mentorships.

title: KaibaCorp
desc: The mission of this organizations is to establish an environment that can unify any and all students across George Mason University through Yu-Gi-Oh and other trading card games. We seek to provide students an area and space to relax, have fun, and decompress from their daily responsibilities

title: Kappa Alpha Order
desc: The mission of Kappa Alpha Order is to be a moral compass for the modern gentlemen. Our organization is rooted in the highest ideals of honor, chivalry, and gentility.

title: Kappa Alpha Psi Fraternity, Inc.
desc: Membership is a solemn commitment. To this Fraternity, the maker of the commitment becomes synonymous with the commitment itself. Membership in Kappa Alpha Psi is a lifelong dedication to the ideas and lofty purposes of Kappa Alpha Psi, which considers for membership only those aspirants whose personal, social and academic qualifications are acceptable to both the College and Fraternity.

title: Kappa Delta Sorority
desc: Kappa Delta Sorority is a national organization for women committed to: encouraging members to live with integrity and honor in the bonds of lifelong friendship; building confidence in members to excel in college and throughout their lives; inspiring members to be active leaders, responsible citizens and engaged members of the community; and providing opportunities and experiences that foster personal and professional growth for a lifetime.

title: Kappa Kappa Psi
desc: We, the brothers of Kappa Kappa Psi, believe that service to the college or university band program fosters responsibility, loyalty, and leadership; that a spirit of brotherhood is enhanced by the participation in a band program; that music is a universal language and truly the greatest of the arts; and that through fraternal participation, each member will strive for the highest.

title: Kappa Phi Gamma Sorority, Inc.
desc: We, the sisters of Kappa Phi Gamma Sorority, Inc., shall create a sisterhood directed towards the advancement of women. Kappa Phi Gamma aims to instill integrity of character and trust as components of personality. The sorority shall encourage the bonding of women in order to strengthen sisterhood. We shall render service to the community and the university, thus supporting the betterment and unification of society. The sisterhood shall develop leadership skills and high academic standards that follow into the professional world. Kappa Phi Gamma shall promote pride of culture, womanhood, and self.

title: Kappa Phi Lambda Sorority, Incorporated
desc: Kappa Phi Lambda Sorority has formed to increase options for the diverse student body of George Mason University. Our Sorority was established in the Spring of 1995 to pursue cultural awareness. In the midst of multiculturalism, we are here to continue the pursuit for unity and to bring forth the much needed consciousness of 'voices' that need to be heard.

title: Klesis
desc: Klesis means invitation in Greek. As Baptist Christian students, we want to extend an invitation to fellow Mason students from all backgrounds for friendly open dialogue about the Bible and life through weekly group meetings, forums, and presentations.

title: Korean Bible Study of GMU
desc: Korean Bible Study is a group of people meeting together to know God through studying the Bible. Korean Bible Study is not limited to any kind of background except the fact that the Bible study is conducted in Korean. The door to Korean Bible Study is open to anyone.

title: Korean International Student Association
desc: The mission of this organization is to provide more information about the Korean culture to all students who are interested in learning beyond what the university is providing. Moreover, KISA aims to connect Korean students on campus to embrace Korean culture and to build stronger culture together. The purpose of this organization does not limit to just the knowledge and facts about the Korean culture and lifestyle but extends to actually being involved and experiencing the Korean lifestyle in person with fellow Korean-Americans. Also outreach to society through different means of community service and cooperate with George Mason Korean Campus.

title: Korean-American Student Association
desc: The Korean-American Student Association at George Mason University is a student-led organization. Our mission is, by learning about the diverse Asian American culture at GMU [specifically Korean], to promote the Korean and American culture while building a positive community. KSA seeks to outreach to society through different means of community service. Throughout the year, KSA hosts events to raise awareness of local and global issues and act upon the awareness. Our goal is to create the leaders of tomorrow with integrity, ambition, and love engraved in their hearts and minds; spread awareness of the Korean Culture by providing and establishing a common ground for Koreans and Non-Koreans alike; and, help international students, including Korean exchange students, find culture in America by facilitating the transition into the American education system and social lifestyle.

title: Kurdish Student Organization
desc: George Mason University's Kurdish Student Organization (KSO) aims to promote and spread Kurdish culture, traditions, and language. KSO is dedicated to promoting an inclusive, diverse space for students to explore the Kurdish culture and all of it's vibrant, yet complex aspects. We encourage all students to participate and join this organization.

title: La Unidad Latina/Lambda Upsilon Lambda Fraternity, Inc.
desc: La Unidad Latina, Lambda Upsilon Lambda Fraternity, Incorporated was established on February 19, 1982 in order to address the shortcomings of academic institutions in meeting and addressing the needs of Latino students in higher education. Founded at Cornell University in Ithaca, New York, La Unidad Latina, Lambda Upsilon Lambda Fraternity, Incorporated primarily seeks to take a leadership role in meeting the needs of the Latino community through academic achievement, cultural awareness, community service, and promotion of the Latino culture and people.

title: Lambda Alpha Epsilon
desc: Lambda Alpha Epsilon's mission is to promote professional, academic, and public awareness of criminal justice and legal issues.Prepare for educational opportunities in the criminal justice or legal fields. Provide a unified voice for students of criminology, law, and government. Foster professionalism, ethics, and high standards for performance in criminal justice, law, and government. Enhance leadership skills necessary in criminal justice, legal, or government occupations.

title: Lambda Sigma National Honor Society
desc: Lambda Sigma Society is a national honor society for second-year men and women dedicated to the purpose of fostering leadership, scholarship, fellowship, and the spirit of service among college students, and to promoting the interests of George Mason University in every possible way. Those who achieve a grade point average of 3.4 or above in their first year at college are invited to apply to Lambda Sigma.

title: Lambda Theta Alpha Latin Sorority, Incorporated.
desc: The purpose of Lambda Theta Alpha shall be to provide a sisterhood based on unity, love and respect in an effort to foster the development of strong leaders who will then provide and practice political, social and cultural activities. It shall also promote unity through charitable and educational programs, maintain a higher standard of learning and serve as a voice for all students.

title: Latinas Promoviendo Comunidad/Lambda Pi Chi Sorority, Inc.
desc: To empower women by providing a supportive network dedicated to their personal and professional advancement. Our Hermandad is further advanced by our shared dedication and promotion of public service and cultural awareness with an emphasis on Latino history, contributions, and experiences.

title: Leadership and Unity among Noble Asian Americans Redefining Standards
desc: The prime missions of LUNARS are:To promote the Asian culture and other cultures among students.To promote personal growth and become better men to society.To bring awareness to problems that our community and other communities are facing.To build a community for men to help them become better as men and leaders.

title: Leadership Education and Development (LEAD)
desc: We believe EVERYONE has the potential to be a leader!We help students to develop as effective, ethical leaders through a series of workshops, conferences, classes, speakers, dialogues, and retreats. Our programs provide opportunities to develop a strong sense of self, augment critical thinking and interpersonal skills, develop global and cultural competencies, and cultivate organizational skills for transition into the professional world.

title: Learning Services
desc: Learning Services, located in SUB I, Suite 3129,  provides a variety of free, experience-based learning opportunities for the Mason Community through one-on-one academic coaching, academic success workshops, and online resources.

title: LGBTQ+ Resources
desc: LGBTQ Resources works to promote the academic success, health and well-being of lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer, and questioning (LGBTQ) students and their allies. We work to sustain and strengthen a campus climate of safety, equity, inclusion, and respect in which LGBTQ and ally students can succeed and thrive at Mason.

title: Liberty Alliance
desc: The Liberty Alliance's purpose is to create is a network of pro-liberty students associated with Young Americans for Liberty and Students for Liberty at George Mason University. Our mission is to educate, empower and mobilize the next generation of leaders of liberty and peace. We aim to embody the principles of individual liberty, non-coercion, and voluntary association.

title: Linguistics Society
desc: The primary goal of the Linguistics Society is to promote and foster the study of human language as a science. In doing so, the Society rejects traditional prescriptive attitudes regarding language use in an effort to explore how people actually use language in their lives; this is the essence of descriptive linguistic study. A meeting of the Linguistics Society is a place for linguists and those interested in language to gather and discuss the intricacies of modern and historical language structure and to encourage understanding and inclusivity of language diversity.

title: Log Rolling Club
desc: We plan to raise awareness of log rolling as a nationally growing sport and hope to become an early presence in the college scene

title: Maaza Club
desc: To celebrate diversity and inclusion amongst George Mason University students.

title: MakeNew Christian Fellowship
desc: MakeNew seeks to be a spiritual home for Mason students who: (1) have grown up Christian and want to continue to grow and mature in their relationship with Jesus Christ; (2) those who have grown up going to church but have yet to personally decide to follow Christ and embrace the Christian faith as their own; and (3) all who are interested in learning about the Christian Faith for the first time.

title: Mariposas Mentoring Program
desc: The purpose of Mariposas Mentoring Program (MMP) is to promote academic excellence and leadership on campus. Our goal is to provide Latinas and other females at Mason with a strong foundation and network, to encourage opportunities for academic excellence, campus involvement and retention of underrepresented groups in higher education.

title: Mason Accounting Society
desc: Our aim is to provide accounting, ISOM, and finance students with the means to network with fellow students and potential employers. We host recruiting, informational and social events on campus throughout the year to help achieve these goals.

title: Mason Adult Students Union
desc: MASU is an organization that focuses on advocating the needs of adult students and improving their well being by providing opportunities for them to find or provide support in their educational endeavors where everyone's contribution is valued and appreciated.

title: Mason Athletic Training Society
desc: To provide a forum for members interested in the field of athletic training. We also want to promote fellowship among members of the Athletic Training Education Program in an intellectual manner.

title: Mason Board Game Club
desc: Johnson Center 3rd floor Room GEvery Thursday from 6pm-midnight. Just walk on in!The purpose of the Mason Board Game Club is to allow mason students to meet new people, foster new friendships, and build confidence and social skills through playing board games with fellow members.

title: Mason CGI U
desc: Mason is a CGI U and allocates funding to support accepted students to attend the annual conference and also funding for their CGIU accepted commitments. The Clinton Global Initiative University (CGI U), the higher education program of the Foundation, activates this next generation through year-round programming that includes access to topic experts and change agents, mentorship networks, financial resources, and community events including the annual CGI U meeting. We are dedicated to supporting students who are committed to take action and address the world's most pressing challenges.

title: Mason Competitive Cyber
desc: Mason Competitive Cyber is established with the purpose of learning cybersecurity, previously by participating in cyber competitions including, but not limited to, Jeopardy-style Capture the Flag competitions, Attack/Defense Capture the Flag competitions, Computer Network Defense competitions, and Forensics competitions, but has since expanded to professional development with corporate partners and tech talks about cybersecurity topics.

title: Mason Consulting Club
desc: 1) To empower students with the skills needed to become successful professionals in the Consulting Industry.2) To provide tools that will optimize leadership potential through student engagement in consulting and beyond.3) To build student confidence in their ability to change the workforce - one person at a time.

title: Mason DanceWorks
desc: Mason DanceWorks' mission is to provide talented Mason students the opportunity to express themselves through the art of dance. Mason DanceWorks will have two showcases a year to show off the choreography and dancing of its members. Our goal is to help each individual grow as a dancer, a choreographer, and a person.

title: Mason DREAMers
desc: To create a more inclusive environment for undocumented immigrants through education and advocacy

title: Mason Entrepreneurship Club
desc: The Mason Entrepreneurship Club is a hotspot for student entrepreneurs to innovate, build on their ideas, and find the pathway to achieving their dreams.

title: Mason Environmental Justice Alliance
desc: The mission of this organization is to campaign for the protection of the environment and its inhabitants through advocacy, activism, and education. We define the environment to include the physical, social, economic, and cultural conditions where we live. We seek to create a diverse movement within the Mason community to make tangible improvements in our environment both locally and in the state of Virginia, and to empower students to take action for a healthy planet for our future. Our goal is to raise awareness on campus regarding different environmental issues on the local, state, and national level, and provide students with an outlet to take action to make change. Join a multidisciplinary group of students passionate about and interested in environmental justice issues.

title: Mason Equestrian Club
desc: "The purpose of this club is to encourage and develop the equestrian abilities in students of GMU and to promote participation in all types of activities dealing with horses and competitive riding. Participants will strive to represent George Mason University in all situations in an upstanding and honorable manner as a sports club and individuals. "

title: Mason Formula One
desc: The George Mason University Formula SAE team, known as Mason Formula One (MF1), seeks to provide the engineering community with an opportunity to develop engineering expertise by applying concepts learned inside the classroom in the hands-on setting of the rigorous international Formula SAE competition. The interdisciplinary nature of designing, computer aided modeling, and fabricating a formula-style vehicle from scratch is a unique chance to best mimic an industry-level engineering project which demands cohesive teamwork from members with various STEM backgrounds.

title: Mason Improv Association
desc: The Mason Improv Association is a student organization that focuses primarily on long-form improvisational comedy. We hold rehearsals, open practice jams, and shows that anybody and everybody is invited to. Any student is permitted and encouraged to attend our practice jams to have fun and grow as an improviser. We also hold yearly auditions to fill spots on our performance team so look out for the dates to be posted!

title: Mason Information Systems and Operations Management Association
desc: The mission of The Mason ISOM Association (MISOMA) is to guide students interested in the Business and Technology related fields through their Academic and Professional careers. We accomplish this through the events we hold each semester for our members.

title: Mason International Culture
desc: Our mission is to bring all cultures into one, the Mason Culture, composed of international students. Sharing our traditions and learning about other cultures.

title: Mason InterVarsity
desc: To be a multiethnic witnessing community that engages every corner of campus with the love of Jesus.

title: Mason Ke Rang
desc: Mason ke Rang is a co-ed organization aimed at bringing together a diversity of different dance styles such as Bollywood, Bhangra, Indian classical, South Indian and Hip-hop to form our Bollywood fusion dance team. Our main mission is to create and spread a culture-filled environment while pursuing expression and love for dance!

title: Mason Kinesiology Club
desc: To promote health and wellness in the community, as well as within the university, the field of kinesiology, and to provide additional educational opportunities to the students, the local community, and the university.

title: Mason Linux Users Group
desc: The purpose of this organization shall be to educate the George Mason University community and public on free and open-source software, digital and rights, and software ethics.

title: Mason Mahima
desc: Mahima is Mason's first and only Indian Classical Dance Team. We strive to bring the grace and talent of all ancient classical art forms and apply them to the beats of contemporary rhythms. We put together all the music and choreography as a team, using the craft and talent of every single dancer. In Indian Culture there are Eight "Siddhis", or "Accomplishments", which are said to be the keys to success in life. One of the Eight Siddhis includes "Mahima" which translates to "Glory" or "Greatness" and encourages thinking big and aiming for higher goals. We hope to let our greatness shine through costume, expression, and dance!

title: Mason Mappers
desc: Mason Mappers is a special interest group on campus that focuses on humanitarian mapping through the use of OpenStreetMap to assist organizations such as the Red Cross or the Peace Corps after natural disasters in areas that need updated maps. We host map-a-thons each semester to get as many people as possible to contribute to these causes. We are also involved with Fairfax County and other groups on campus to collaborative on projects and events. As a group, we hope to foster a geo-community that values knowledge, volunteering, and collaboration.

title: Mason Model World Health Organization
desc: The Mason World Health Organization Conference (MWHO) aims to introduce and educate students with realistic rules of a WHO World Health Assembly meeting. MWHO mimics the political, social, and economic realities defining global health policies. Student delegates will debate, prepare legislation, and vote on resolutions that could potentially be forwarded to the WHO headquarters for consideration.

title: Mason Motorcycle Club
desc: Our mission is to be a collective group of motorcycle riders and those interested in learning about motorcycles. We hope to bring awareness to the community of George Mason about motorcycle safety, as well as help inform them of the best motorcycling practices.

title: Mason MTG
desc: GMU MTG is dedicated to bringing a safe and fun place to play Magic the Gethering to the GMU student body

title: Mason Mukti
desc: Mason Mukti aims to bring the richness of indian music with a blend of western harmony in order to create diverse music that evokes various emotions. With this, the club expects to form a group where the members deeply connect while creating, singing, playing, and learning music together. Mukti means peace, and this club hopes to create an atmosphere that brings tranquility through the music and the people.

title: Mason Muslim Affairs Council
desc: MMAC is a non-partisan student led organization that aims to provide a safe space for civic-minded student leaders to voice concerns about issues that are affecting the world today.We focus on human rights, social justice, leadership, and advocacy. As young leaders and professionals, we offer our members networking opportunities with various nonprofits and government agencies. Additionally, we encourage students to be civically engaged and be vocal in today's political discourse.

title: Mason Noise CrowdSource
desc: The primary objective of Mason Noise CrowdSource is to provide students interested in the recording arts a means to gain professional and academic experience in a hands-on setting; by supporting the initiatives, objectives, and endeavors of the currently established campus-wide record label, Mason Noise. Each semester, members of Mason Noise CrowdSource will collaborate on a Primary Recording Project involving several students from Mason Noise and the Music Technology program of the GMU School of Music. Secondary projects may also arise during the semester, but will not take priority over the Primary Recording Project. Students can gain experience in recording and mixing in a hands-on setting, take on roles that they can add to their resumes, meet other students who share a common interest in Music Technology, and establish connections.

title: Mason Pokemon Club
desc: The Goal of this club is to allow people who are enthusiastic about pokemon to be able to spend time with other people who share this interest. This club will be a way for people to relax and focus on something that isn't quite as serious as normal classes.

title: Mason Powerlifting
desc: Mason Powerlifting is a place to provide an environment for students to come together and help further each otherâ€™s Powerlifting and general strength training goals. We mainly try to focus on prepping our club athletes for competition and having strength athletes meet each other to have training partners.

title: Mason Psychology Club
desc: The GMU Psychology Club is a student-run organization that allows students with an interest in psychology to build leadership and communication skills while expanding their understanding and knowledge of psychology.

title: Mason Quidditch Club
desc: The purpose of the George Mason Club Quidditch is to present students with a unique opportunity for exercise and social interaction. This organization will challenge members to think outside of the box, combining the worlds of several sports into one. Members of George Mason Club Quidditch will be challenged to develop cunning physical and mental skills in learning a game that is truly unique, while joining together with people of similar interest and love of the sport.

title: Mason Racing
desc: Our goal is to design, build, and race an ATV style car known as a Baja Car. We are able to accomplish this goal using CAD software, engineering calculations, and machining techniques learned during the year.

title: Mason Recreation
desc: Mason Recreation inspires an inclusive atmosphere that fosters lifelong well-being for the University’s diverse students and community through active experiences, education, and engagement.

title: Mason Russian Club
desc: Mason Russian Club is dedicated to the promotion and facilitation of Russian language and culture at George Mason University. As an organization we are determined to facilitate education for all individuals interested in the vastness of this rich culture through film screenings, culinary samples, historical exhibits and presentations, guest speakers, discussions on current events, and Russian conversation hours. Mason Russian Club fosters an open environment for people to come and learn about Russian and Slavic civilization from multiple perspectives.

title: Mason SCUBA Club
desc: To support and be a resource for members of the Mason community who are interested in SCUBA for both future work (i.e. students entering the field of marine biology, engineering, aquatic ecology etc.), and for recreation.To create opportunities for further exploration for students and faculty/staff members who are SCUBA enthusiasts by Providing further education and resources within our school community. Organizing events to promote and enhance the SCUBA experience. Arranging trips to local, national and international SCUBA destinations

title: Mason Some Noise
desc: Mason Some Noise is George Mason's premier co-ed a cappella group! We perform mainly pop songs but have dabbled in other genres of music. Founded in 2014, MSN performs at events on campus and in the DC area. Our group is exemplary of one of GMU's best features: its diversity. We are a group of many different races, ethnicities, ages, majors, and personalities that unites in our love of music and friendship. We consistently raise the bar of excellence in our collegiate a cappella community and rehearse with this goal in mind. We hold auditions every semester, so if you love to sing, beatbox, or arrange, we hope you join our family!

title: Mason Spirit Squad
desc: The Mason Spirit Squad is a student-led marketing team for the Office of Student Involvement and beyond. The mission of this group is to connect students with George Mason through programs, traditions, events, and the creation of a shared student experience. Our goal is to develop and maintain a healthy relationship between students and campus engagement. We are looking for students who are passionate about Mason, want to increase Patriot Pride, and are not afraid to take risks in the name of school spirit. This is an opportunity to develop career ready skills and help make Mason a better place. We look forward to working with you OR seeing you at the next Mason event!

title: Mason Taekwondo
desc: "To teach Taekwondo and self-defense to George Mason Students and in doing so teaching them the five tenets of Taekwondo: courtesy, integrity, perseverance, self-control, and indomitable spirit. "

title: Mason Veteran Patriots
desc: MVP is a student veteran led organization that connects with the local, national, and global community. We believe in promoting our University, exchanging career resources, networking, serving our community, and supporting each other's academic endeavors.

title: Masonic Dance Collective
desc: Masonic Dance Collective aims to provide an artistic platform for dancers on campus. We host free classes as well as performance opportunities. Through our organization we hope to spread the joy of dance to anyone who wants to participate.

title: MBA Student Association
desc: The mission of the George Mason University MBA Student Association (MBASA) is to enhance the experience of George Mason University MBA candidates through meaningful social, professional, and educational activities. Our goal is to create an intellectual forum where business topics and ideas can be shared, disseminated, and debated. Participation in the MBASA will provide students with opportunities to network with classmates, colleagues, and local business leaders. We strive to create lasting benefits for MBA candidates through interaction with students, faculty, alumni, business professionals, and business organizations and to create lasting friendships and professional relationships through our programs.

title: MedX Global
desc: MedX Global is designed to engage undergraduate students in global health development with a focus on healthcare as a human right. We act as a powerful extension of traditional health science routes, involving students in multidisciplinary applications of academic work and the realization of service-oriented culture.

title: Men's Club Ultimate
desc: Our mission is to provide a competitive and fun environment to play ultimate Frisbee while providing an equal opportunity to everyone involved.

title: Men's Club Volleyball
desc: Group of competitive volleyball players that want to play against other competitive teams without having the high level of commitment of D1 but are more competitive than intramurals.

title: Men's Ice Hockey
desc: To provide George Mason University students the ability to compete in an organized hockey league, promoting fair play, social atmosphere and an arena to develop physical and social skills. We give high-level players the opportunity to continue their playing careers in a supportive environment with an emphasis on academics. Returning and newly rostered players will each be issued 2 Pro Stock Team 450G Low Kick Point CCM hockey sticks. Each player will be issued new, custom CCM shells, as well as new, custom Warrior team gear bags.As usual, players will be issued green, white and gold jerseys as well as game socks. Jerseys remain the property of the team and will be returned at the end of the season (except for graduating senior who will be offered their gold jersey).  Socks will remain the players' property.Newly rostered players will receive also be issued custom Bauer team gloves, as well as a CCM team jacket.NOTE:  effective the 2018-19 season, players will be required to purchase their own gold helmet / white cage – which will be available at the Prince William Ice Center for purchase at a team discount rate.Dues include lodging and bus transportation for away games which are 90 minutes or further away from GMU.Dues include the cost of ice time for 35 practice slots (10:30PM on Monday / 9:00PM on Wednesday) and 16 home games.

title: Middle Eastern Student Association
desc: The purpose of the Middle Eastern Student Association is to bring awareness and enlighten GMU students on the culture, beliefs and traditions of the Middle East. We strive to celebrate the middle eastern culture and elevate the perception of that region. We want to create a welcoming and lively environment for all students, middle eastern or not.

title: Model United Nations
desc: Model United Nations strives to offer students the opportunity to explore a wide range of international policy issues through debate at a variety of conferences each year. We travel as a team to compete against other colleges throughout the nation at collegiate conferences. We hold our own conference (MASUN) for high school students to experience Model United Nations. We attempt to spread understanding of international cultures, how they interact, and how our world came to be and where it is going by holding cultural events throughout the year.

title: Movement Exchange at George Mason University
desc: We are a growing community of Dance Diplomats movers and shakers, activists and global citizens, dreamers and achievers, teachers and learners, volunteers and friends. We believe that sharing movement creates more joy in our world. Mason Movement Exchange is a campus chapter of an international non-profit organization that is based out of San Fransisco. Founded in 2011, Movement Exchange has since engaged over 300 dance diplomats in 6,900 hours of international service and 2,700 hours of domestic service. Movement Exchange's international service takes place in Panama in orphanges, community centers and universities. At home, Mason Move-Ex serves the Fairfax community by offering free dance classes to in-need communities. Our values include-Cross-cultural understanding-Civic engagement-Social equality and inclusion-Creative expression-Sustainable dance education

title: Multicultural Greek Council
desc: The Multicultural Greek Council will promote and support the development and sustainability of multicultural Greek fraternities and sororities through mutual respect, appreciation, and acceptance. The council will promote the values and ideals of Greek life for all Greek councils, campus organizations and the greater campus community.

title: Multicultural Student Association of Pre-health Students
desc: The Multicultural Association of Pre-Health Students (MAPS), formerly the Minority Association of Premedical Students, is an organization, encourages and prepares students to become competitive applicants for medical school or other health field programs. This organization is committed to promoting diversity and enhancing the recruitment of culturally diverse students in the healthcare field. Any student who believes in the MAPS mission is welcome. MAPS was originally founded at GMU in the Fall of 2012 and has just recently been re-established starting Fall of 2015. As an organization we have gathered and motivated students interested in medicine to pursue their desired professions. MAPS encourages students to network and seek experiences necessary to succeed in the healthcare field. In addition to our monthly meetings, we have speakers, resume clinics, and the opportunity to attend health conferences around the DC Area and nationwide.

title: Multilingual Multicultural Education Student Interest Group
desc: MMESIG is for PhD students in education who have Multicultural/multilingual interests to provide program information, conferences, and publication possibilities and to share successes and good news among faculty and students, to organize professional events that related to MME field. We also expect for socializing around shared interests in MME, promoting professional education collaboration in MME PhD student community, and attending to both the growth of our knowledge but also providing a network to support each other.

title: Music Productions Club
desc: The Music Productions Club (MPC) is a social organization that strives to build connections between musicians and music enthusiasts. Our goal is to encourage members to discuss, practice, create and share music with others.

title: Muslim Leadership Development
desc: The purposes for which Muslim Leadership Development is formed are to serve as a gateway and development from college into community leadership; foster a community that is geared towards learning both spiritually and professionally; undertake and engage in religious, charitable, educational and Dawah related activities; establish brotherhood and sisterhood based on the Islamic principles of equality, mutual help, and love.

title: Muslim Students' Association
desc: The Muslim Students' Association is a student organization which seeks to impart the pure teachings of Islam to Muslims and Non-Muslims alike. Additionally, we hope to aid in fostering unity among Muslims on campus. We hope to achieve this through jum'ah prayers on campus, lectures, workshops, halaqas/study circles, and various other events.

title: Muslim Writers' Collective GMU Chapter
desc: The purpose of the Muslim Writers Collective is to reclaim the American Muslim narrative through the creative arts. It provides a safe space for young writers and artists to share their story in a setting which is geared to came them feel comfortable in which their voice is not overlooked, is not a minority, is not a marginalized demographic.

title: My Natural Inc.
desc: As we live by the purpose of My Natural, we will develop a plan to reach college women that want help to grow mentally, physically and emotionally on the campus of George Mason University. My Natural will guide members to creating a self definition, while we all provide each other with resources, create a sisterhood and have fun. In watching each other grow, we will be empowered to influence other women in our lives.

title: My Training International
desc: Our organization helps international students improve their leadership and organizational skills.

title: National Art Education Association Student Chapter
desc: To advance art education through professional development, service, advancement of knowledge, and leadership and to support the Art Education programs within the Art and Visual Technology department.

title: National Association for the Advancement of Colored People
desc: The mission of the GMU NAACP shall be to inform youth of the problems affecting African Americans and other racial and ethnic minorities; to advance the economic, education, social and political status of African Americans and other racial and ethnic minorities and their harmonious cooperation with other peoples; to stimulate an appreciation of the African Diaspora and other people of color's contribution to civilization; and to develop an intelligent, militant effective youth leadership.

title: National Association of Black Accountants
desc: The National Association of Black Accountants (NABA) George Mason University Student Chapter seeks to address the professional needs of its members while building leaders that shape the future of the accounting and finance profession. NABA-GMU holds a high interest in students who possess a strong sense of civic responsibility, a desire for excellence both inside and outside of the classroom, as well as those who are interested in promoting opportunities for minorities in the fields of accounting, finance and other business related professions.

title: National Honor Society for Dance Arts
desc: The primary purpose of the National Honor Society for Dance Arts (NHSDA): George Mason University School of Dance is to recognize outstanding artistic merit, leadership and academic achievement in students studying dance in colleges/universities. Further, the NHSDA hopes to foster an appreciation for dance as a true art form and one worthy of recognition and prestige. The NHSDA is a national program of the National Dance Education Organization.

title: National Pan-Hellenic Council
desc: GMU NPHC shall be to foster unity and cooperative actions of its members in dealing with matters of trust, respect, and teamwork between each member organization.

title: National Society of Black Engineers
desc: NSBE'smission is "to increase the number of culturally responsible Black Engineers who excel academically, succeed professionally and positively impact the community." NSBE offers its members leadership training, professional development activities, mentoring, career placement services, community service opportunities and more.

title: National Society of Collegiate Scholars at George Mason University
desc: A. To recognize and celebrate high achievement among first and second year students in all academic disciplines.B. To encourage and promote high standards throughout the collegiate experience.C. To provide opportunities for personal growth and leadership development for members.D. To provide scholarships, such as the Merit Award, Scholar Abroad, Scholar at Sea, and Graduate to member(s) who successfully apply and compete for these awards.E. To organize and encourage learning opportunities through community service.F. To foster an overall appreciation for the value of the higher education experience.G. To continue to uphold the standards determined by the Association of College Honor Societies as part of the organizationâ€™s membership.

title: National Society of Pershing Rifles
desc: To aid in the development of successful officers in the Army, Navy, and Air Force. To foster camaraderie and esprit de corps among all three Reserve Officers' Training Corps programs. The National Society is open to any member of the George Mason Community, and fosters their development and leadership along with giving them opportunities to work alongside Reserve Officers' Training Corps programs.

title: Native American and Indigenous Alliance
desc: We shall share and celebrate Native American and Indigenous culture with students at George Mason University and the surrounding community, centering around anti-colonial perspectives. We are dedicated to assisting Native American and Indigenous students' transition to college, promoting Indigenous culture, raising awareness of Native issues and providing a safe environment for Native and non-Native students.

title: Nepalese Student Organization
desc: Promote and raise awareness about Nepalese language, literature, cultural and arts through various activities.Promote the unity amongst NSA Mason members at George Mason University (GMU).Diversify membership through recruiting new members.Promote discussions on topics of national and international areas of interest amongst its members as well as members of other organizations.Provide Peer Counseling and Advising to Nepalese Students at GMU.Plan and coordinate social and cultural activities with organizations who express an interest in working with the NSA Mason.Participate in community activities outside of George Mason University.Arrange special functions to commemorate various Nepalese holidays and festivals.

title: NetBrain
desc: Our focus is on broadening the applications of artifical intelligence, while innovating creative solutions that can impact the world.

title: Neuroscience Graduate Student Organization
desc: The main mission of the Neuroscience Graduate Student Organization (NGSO) is to promote social and educational interaction among the graduate student peers in the Interdisciplinary Program in Neuroscience at GMU. Our mission includes the following goals: promotion of social and educational interaction among peer clubs at GMU, education through biweekly journal clubs and symposia, collaboration with local scientific organizations and outreach and interaction with the neuroscience community and peer clubs of the greater Washington DC area.

title: New Student and Family Programs
desc: To deliver purposeful programs and services for students and families that promote a comprehensive initiation into and deepen a sense of belonging to George Mason University.

title: Next Gen Global Health Security MASON
desc: "Next Gen GHS Mason aims to engage early and mid-career professionals working at the intersection of health and security in global efforts to prevent, detect, and respond to infectious disease threats through education, interdisciplinary collaboration, and advocacy. Our intent is to build the foundation for enduring professional relationships across the multiple disciplines relevant to addressing the 21st Century biodefense challenges."

title: Noteworthy Women's A Capella
desc: Noteworthy is George Mason's first and only all women's a capella group. We are a diverse and welcoming group of women with a passion for music and love sharing that passion with surrounding communities. Our repertoire consists of pop music ranging from songs that will make you groove to songs that will soothe you.

title: NxGeneration Campus Ministry
desc: The purpose of the NxGeneration is to help young people mature in their faith, give back to the community, andcontinue to increase in wisdom and stature as Jesus did, through prayer, sharing of the Word, and loving ourfellow brothers and sisters; so they can impact their world for Christ.

title: Order of Omega
desc: OoO Recognize those students who have attained a high standard of leadership in inter-Greek activities, to encourage them to continue along this line, and to inspire others to strive for similar conspicuous attainment. Bring together the most representative fraternity and sorority members, and to create an organization which will help mold the sentiment of the institution on questions of local and intercollegiate affairs. Facilitate cooperative activities and functions that cater to and are appealing for all governing bodies within our Greek Community. Encourage cooperation and harmony among all Greek Members through the cross council interactions and programming.

title: Oriental Culture Club
desc: Oriental Culture Club is to promote and educate students traditional, non-government, but authentic Eastern culture through intellectual events and activities, such as guest speakers series and social events.

title: Orthodox Christian Fellowship
desc: Orthodox Christian Fellowship (OCF) transforms the lives of college students in the United States and Canada by guiding them along the path to Jesus Christ through His Church, cultivating a campus community of worship, witness, service, fellowship andeducation.

title: Pacific Islander Student Association
desc: We will work with individuals who come from or want to learn about the islands in the Pacific (ex. Okinawa and Taiwan). The culture and language of many Pacific islands differ from the mainland; our club's goal is to have informative activities that will educate others about the heritage as well as raise money to help individuals on the islands who are not as fortunate.

title: Pakistani Student Association
desc: Our goal is to promote Pakistani culture and activities both on and off campus as well as to display Pakistani heritage through a variety of events throughout the year.

title: Panhellenic Council
desc: The mission of the Panhellenic Council is to support the 8 social sororities on George Mason Campus. The Panhellenic Council is the governing body of our community. We work to unify, empower, educate and inspire our women through educational and social programming. In addition, the Panhellenic Council acts out legislative procedures and ensures our women follow our rules and regulations.

title: Parking and Transportation Services
desc: Mason’s Parking and Transportation department works to support transportation systems that serve the needs of students, faculty, staff, visitors, and event patrons on George Mason's Fairfax campus. While responding to the university's growth in the past and anticipating future growth, Parking and Transportation Services is committed to designing and supporting more environmentally friendly modes of transportation to reduce Mason’s environmental footprint, provide numerous affordable options for our students, and support Mason’s academic mission.

title: Pathways To Peace
desc: We are an unaffiliated student-led organization that is seeking to build a culture of peace by providing open dialogue as a means of understanding and learning about the Palestinian-Israeli conflict between individuals and organizations with different perspectives and cultural backgrounds. Our goal is to promote peacebuilding across campus by educating individuals on mutual understanding and managing conflict. This organization will help students at George Mason to embrace diversity by collaborating with other organizations to further cultural understanding.

title: Patriot Activities Council
desc: The Patriot Activities Council enhances the college experience for all Mason students by providing entertaining, impactful, low- or no-cost events that appeal to various interests in order to create a more engaged, connected, and active student body.The Patriot Activities Council brings you the largest, the greatest, and the most extravagant events to the George Mason campus! From large events such as Mason Day to off-campus events such as movie premieres to the latest movies - PAC does it all! The Patriot Activities Council works to create once in a life time experiences for George Mason students that cannot be found on other college campuses.We are known for producing the major events on campus such as: Mason Day, One Love Cultural Festival, Homecoming Week, HIV/AIDS Awareness Fashion Show, Spring Concerts, and much much more!Be on the lookout for PAC events throughout the semester! Interested in getting involved on campus, join the STREET TEAM to get a behind the scenes and get an inside scoop of all the cool things that PAC is planning and other opportunities!

title: Patriot Christian Ministry
desc: We exist to share the love of Jesus through community and service to George Mason students.

title: Patriot Experience
desc: The Patriot Experience provides students with a focused approach to prepare for life after Mason by developing skills through self-directed experiential learning.

title: Patriot Pitches
desc: On October 31st, 2013 a small group of friends with a shared interest in vocal music founded George Mason University’s first co-ed a cappella group. Looking to professional groups and other established collegiate a cappella ensembles for inspiration, the founders sought to bring the sounds of vocal pop music to northern Virginia. Over five years, the Pitches have grown from a small contingent of a cappella enthusiasts to a 16-person ensemble which performs actively in the DC-Metro area and competes in national a cappella competitions. Last year, the Pitches had the privilege of making their ICCA competition debut and released their first-ever music video, Boyband Medley, in August!

title: Patriot Rescue
desc: The mission of Patriot Rescue is to provide exceptional pre-hospital care to the students, faculty, staff, and visitors of George Mason University. This is accomplished through a commitment to training, education, and outreach at the local, state, and national level.

title: Patriots for Choice
desc: The purpose of Patriots for Choice shall be to support and protect, as a fundamental right and value, a person's freedom to make personal decisions regarding the full range of reproductive choices by building a strong pro-choice presence on campus, educating and encouraging dialogue in the campus community and advocating for privacy rights and expanded reproductive health choices on campus and in the community. We are affiliated with NARAL Pro-choice VA.

title: Patriots for Health Assistance
desc: We engage in community services that assist the medical community and improve community health, mainly for those who are underprivileged. We seek to fundraise for medical research and educate students about current and predominate medical issues.

title: Patriots for Peace
desc: Our mission is to promote the United States' Institute of Peace's goals to prevent, mitigate, and resolve violent conflict around the world through the development of and interaction in a global network of young peace builders.

title: Patriots of Persia
desc: Salam Patriots, we are a nonexclusive student organization fighting to liberate Iran and help transition it towards democracy.

title: Peace Jam
desc: To enhance cultural, intellectual, social and recreational aspects of student life at GMU and other high schools within social justice issues.

title: PERIOD @ GMU
desc: "PERIOD @ GMU is focused on fighting period poverty and ending the stigma around periods through service, education and advocacy. Through service, this organization will partner with local non-profits to distribute PERIOD PACKS to those in need. Through education, this organization aims to change the way we as a society talk about periods, while destigmatizing the way do so. Finally, through advocacy, this organization will raise awareness and create change through events, campaigns and media relationships. One prominent goal is repealing the tampon tax and bringing menstrual products in public spaces, including the GMU campus."

title: Persian Club
desc: To preserve and promote Persian language, literature, history, music, dance, art, food, and cultural celebrations for the benefit of Iranians as well as other communities within the Washington DC Metropolitan area.

title: PhD in Education Student Organization
desc: The organization is established to advance collegiality, advocatefor doctoral student needs, and develop and sustain professionalrelationships among the doctoral students, faculty, and staff within the College of Education and Human Development. With this in mind, the CEHD PhD Student Organization seeks to:1. Foster informal and formal interactions, collaborations, andaccountability;2. Provide an open and inclusive forum for our membership toexpress their concerns, achievement, and ideas that prepare members for continued research, future academia, and careers in our fields;3. Promote professional development through discussions,presentations, and trainings that strengthen our scholarly endeavors;4. Share advice, resources, and experiences to assist one anotherthrough doctoral studies;5. Host social and networking events on and off campus to createcommunity6. Foster a sense of belonging and success for diverse PhD students e.g. underrepresented students according to their race, ethnicity, socioeconomic level, culture, language, nationality, ability level, immigration status, gender identity, sexual orientation, expression of religion, or/and additional underrepresented backgrounds;7. Represent the collective opinions and shared interests of ourmembership to the appropriate authorities at the department, College, University level and beyond; and8. Encourage participation in activities relating to the organization and collaboration with the College of Education and Human Development, its various departments, and George Mason University.

title: Phi Alpha Delta
desc: George Mason's Phi Alpha Delta Chapter was established to form a pre-law community on campus where students are offered for law school, LSAT and personal statement workshops, law school preparation resources, and networking opportunities.

title: Phi Beta Sigma Fraternity, Incorporated
desc: The brothers of Phi Beta Sigma are the Fraternity's most valuable resource and strength. They are the primary means by which the Phi Beta Sigma objectives will be achieved. In order to accomplish the Fraternity's objectives, it is essential that systems are instituted that effectively embody "Culture For Service and Service For Humanity" and promote brotherhood, scholarship and service.

title: Phi Iota Alpha Fraternity, Inc.
desc: The mission of Phi Iota Alpha Fraternity, Inc is to increase consciousness of Latin American issues in the US and foment a greater understanding of what can be done to create solutions. The prime ideal of the organization is Pan-Americanism; to unite all in an effort to minimize and eventually dissolve any barriers between groups in and out of Latin America. We enjoy creating events that help make the Mason Community culturally competent with the variant customs, practices, and beliefs of Latin American people.NAME: Phi Iota Alpha Fraternity, IncNICKNAME: PhiotaFRATERNAL SCOPE: InternationalESTABLSHED: December 26, 1931FOUNDING SCHOOL: Rensselaer Polytechnic InstituteFRATERNAL SYMBOL: LionFRATERNAL FLOWER: Red CarnationOFFICIAL COLORS: Gold, Navy Blue, Red, and WhiteMOTTO: "Semper Parati, Semper Juncti"PUBLICATION: The Phiota!NATIONAL PHILANTHROPY: United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF)

title: Phi Kappa Sigma
desc: Phi Kappa Sigma is a social Fraternity and a male leadership organization. It is an invaluable learning experience, a philosophy for living and a life-long commitment. Along with the Ritual, our purpose and principles state what our organization is and who we are as brothers of our fraternity. All brothers take an oath to uphold these ideals, and it is up to all to ensure that we, present and future, learn and understand what is required to incorporate being a true Phi Kap in the Gamma Xi Chapter, George Mason University, the Fairfax community, and our lives after school.

title: Phi Mu Alpha Sinfonia
desc: The mission of this fraternity shall be for the development of the best and truest fraternal spirit; the mutual welfare and brotherhood of musical students; the advancement of music in America and a loyalty to the Alma Mater.

title: Phi Sigma Kappa
desc: Phi Sigma Kappa is a lifelong brotherhood dedicated to the betterment of the individual, the university community, and our world, by giving its members opportunities to develop leadership skills, participate in service to others, achieve academic excellence, experience cultural diversity and practice personal integrity.

title: Phi Sigma Pi National Honor Fraternity
desc: Phi Sigma Pi National Honor Fraternity is a gender-inclusive organization dedicated to: promoting lifelong learning, inspiring Members to lead, and cultivating lasting fraternal bonds, while always conducting our lives with honor. We consecrate ourselves to a life of social service with the goal of improving humanity through our principles: Scholarship, Leadership, and Fellowship.

title: Philosophy Club
desc: To talk and learn about the greatest minds and ideas that humanity has ever produced.

title: Physical Education Teachers Education Society
desc: The purpose of this organization will be to unite physical education majors through networking, mentorship and physical activity as well as encouraging the sharing of teaching ideas. To encourage members of the university to live healthy and active lifestyles and promote the fundamentals of physical activity.

title: Physics and Astronomy Society at Mason
desc: The Physics and Astronomy Society at Mason is dedicated to creating an intellectually stimulating space that cultivates an interest in physics and/or astronomy. We hope to support one another in our endeavors, collaborate on projects and research. This society is opened to all students, regardless of their major.

title: Pi Beta Phi
desc: Virginia Iota is a part of the international Pi Beta Phi Fraternity for Women. In Virginia Iota, each member is held to a high standard of excellence in academics, service to others, friendship, and community involvement on campus.

title: Pi Delta Psi Fraternity, Incorporated
desc: Pi Delta Psi Fraternity, Inc. was formed to increase options for the diverse student body here at GMU and bring different groups of people together through the means of our four pillars and those seeking an eternal brotherhood.

title: Pi Kappa Alpha
desc: Our mission is to better the values in every person we come in contact with, while promoting high scholarship. We are here to help all our members be successful in school, in the work force, and in life.

title: Pi Kappa Phi
desc: Pi Kappa Phi was founded on the premise of creating leadership opportunities for our members. Our founders exemplified leadership in the classroom, on the athletic field, in campus politics and within the community of Charleston. Leadership is the very root of our organization, and it is the concept of leadership that shall guide us to our future. A future where every Pi Kappa Phi embraces his role as a leader, puts service before self and improves the world around him.

title: Platypus Affiliated Society
desc: The Platypus Affiliated Society, established in December 2006, organizes reading groups, public fora, research, and journalism focused on problems and tasks inherited from the "Old" (1920s-30s), "New" (1960s-70s), and post-political (1980s-90s) Left for the possibilities of emancipatory politics today.

title: Poker Strategy Club
desc: The purpose of this organization is to study and practice the concepts of no-limit hold'em poker. We will learn various elements of the game including statistics and probability, the psychology of decision making and game theory. The ultimate goal is to help improve the thought process and skillsets that will help students beyond the game of poker.

title: Police Research Group
desc: To bring together students of George Mason University (GMU) who are interested in policing to share research interests, and to provide an organizing body for professional development opportunities.

title: Pop'Out Dancerz
desc: Pop Out dancerz focuses on different urban Afro-Caribbean dance styles with the goal to instill an appreciation for Caribbean and West Indian culture as One People across campus. At the same time spreading awareness for different caribbean cultures

title: Pre-Dental Society
desc: The mission of the Pre-Dental Society is to prepare interested George Mason University students for a career in dentistry. While continuously promoting fellowship between students, we strive to inform them on various aspects of the application process, opportunities in the field of dentistry, and services to the community.

title: Pre-Optometry Club
desc: The Pre-Optometry Club of George Mason University is an organization which serves the needs of students interested in Optometry. We want to educate, encourage, and exchange academic and life experiences with students interested in vision health. Information about the Schools of Optometry in the United States, pre-requisite requirements, and the Optometry Admissions Test (OAT) will be provided. We invite local optometrists, school representatives, and current optometry students as guest speakers. Future plans include fundraising for eye health organizations, volunteering and leadership opportunities.

title: Pre-Pharmacy Honor Society
desc: Pre-Pharmacy Honor Society is an organization for all students interested in pursuing a career in pharmaceuticals or simply interested in learning what pharmacists do as a career. This club prepares students for the rigorous academic program in becoming a pharmacist, as well as providing advice to make transitioning into pharmacy school easier. Our goal is to inspire students to reach great heights within the field of pharmacy.

title: Pre-Veterinary Club
desc: The mission of the society is: To prepare pre-veterinary students by providing opportunities to gain the experience and knowledge needed for veterinary school. To encourage education on veterinary topics in the community. To gather like-minded people to discuss animal related topics about veterinary medicine. To provide service for the benefit of animal related organizations, charities, and the community.

title: Premedical Society
desc: The mission of Premedical Society is to encourage involvement among a plethora of academic backgrounds that pursue a career in the medical field at the undergraduate level. Our goal is to encourage the student body of George Mason University to partake in meetings that encompass gradual, yet detailed MCAT preparation. As an organization, we strive to emphasize the importance of achieving hands on experience within the field of medicine by providing information regarding volunteer, research, and internship experiences. In addition, we will have a variety of activities planned for students to engage in social networking.

title: Pride Alliance
desc: Pride Alliance at George Mason University will be an organization for people of all genders, sexualities, orientations, and expressions. Our goal is: 1. ensure a safe, accepting space for LGBTQ+ students to reside and meet with in. 2. Cultivate a sense of pride with in the community on campus. 3. Proactively organize both on and off campus for our livelihoods and wellbeing. 4. Educate both LGBTQ+ students, allies, and others about the LGBTQ+ community within Mason and beyond. 5. Stay committed to the diversity of Mason, and ensure conversations are inclusive to all who wish to come.

title: Promises United in God
desc: We are to have fellowship in Christ and enjoy dinner every first Friday of each month!

title: Psi Chi: The International Honor Society in Psychology
desc: Psi Chi is an international honor society whose purpose shall be to encourage, stimulate, and maintain excellence in scholarship of the individual members in all fields, particularly in psychology, and to advance the science of psychology.

title: Public Relations Student Society of America
desc: The Public Relations Student Society of America (PRSSA) is the foremost organization for students interested in public relations and communications. We seek to advance the public relations profession by nurturing generations of future professionals. We advocate rigorous academic standards for public relations education, the highest ethical principles and diversity in the profession.

title: Public Sociology Association
desc: The Public Sociology Association is dedicated to the development and enhancement of student engagement within the community, as well as to boost public awareness and to work to create a more informed public concerning issues surrounding sociology. The PSA seeks to utilize sociological concepts to work with and for the public for the purpose of promoting social justice.

title: Queen In You
desc: Queen In You (QIY) is an organization of female collegiate students and alumni who dedicate time to train future queens in the areas of professional development, self-esteem, etiquette, scholarship, service, and the advancement of colored women. We mentor young girls to promote women's advancement, professional enhancement, community-service, etiquette training and the social well being of its members through participation in organizational activities such as community service, full body meetings, fundraising, and social events. Queen In You is founded upon the principal: "Empowered women, empowering women."

title: Radical Organizers for Socialism and Equity
desc: "Raise awareness within and educate the George Mason University student body about socialism and other leftist ideologies. Promote socialist and leftist activism within our local community and the George Mason student body through organizing events as well as aiding other similarly minded organizations. We are a socialist and anti-capitalist organization. We favor an intersectional approach to activism as opposed to class-reductionism. All forms of oppression must be addressed if we want to fight for a socialist society. "

title: Ratio Christi
desc: Ratio Christi, Latin for the reason of Christ, wants to help reverse the trend of anti-intellectual Christianity. This general body meeting is open to all students and aims to fill the intellectual gap, to make Christianity something worth thinking about, both personally and at George Mason University.

title: Rehabilitation Science Club
desc: GMU Rehabilitation Science Club's mission is to provide an organization of undergraduate and graduate PhD students. This club helps undergraduate students get prepared for professional graduate school. The club also comes together to discuss topics of interest, such as optimizing human performance, the disability process, and rehabilitation science.

title: Reign Model Troupe
desc: The Reign Model Troupe is a student organization promoting high self-esteem, self-confidence, and the ability to brand yourself through modeling, performing, production, and fashion.

title: Resident Student Association
desc: The Resident Student Association (RSA) is a student organization for all students living in the residence halls at Mason. RSA is committed to making your residence hall experience exceptional by providing campus-wide events, advocacy initiatives, and leadership opportunities. Serve as a member of the Executive BoardAttend weekly RSA General Body meetingsAttend RSA events and provide feedback Attend conferences on the regional and national level Provide opportunity to address concerns and issues with higher campus administration

title: Revival Ministries
desc: We're a non-denominational ministry devoted to spreading God's living Light and Hope through knowledge of His Word and Truth.

title: Roosevelt at Mason
desc: Roosevelt @ Mason seeks to empower students with the resources and environment to become effectively involved in the policy process at the campus, local, state, and national levels. The Roosevelt Institute engages in policy research, analysis, and writing to increase youth voices at all levels of the policy process. Roosevelt @ Mason promotes communication and coordination with community members, stakeholders, and policymakers in order to create real policy-oriented solutions. The ultimate goal of the organization is to facilitate progressive policy innovation in the local political process."

title: RSO Leadership Team
desc: The mission of the RSO Leadership Team is to promote collaboration among student organizations while facilitating the development, maintenance, and transitions of RSOs.

title: Sarangi Ko Dhun
desc: Dance allows us to show the beauty of a Nepali culture. Through this organization, we hope to spread cultural awareness by performing at different events in the east coast. We also plan on building a dance network among different Nepal groups across the United States and becoming the 1st university to host a Nepali dance competition in the country.

title: Saudi Student Association
desc: The Saudi Student Association (SSA) is a very known association at George Mason University that represents the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia. The goal of our association is to make Saudi students feel like they never left home by providing them with a variety of events and activities that they can enjoy. Our mission does not stop there, we try to reflect our country and culture in the best way possible for non-Saudi students to have a better picture of our great nation.

title: Save the Children
desc: The purpose of this club is to increase awareness, influence public policy, educate and raise funds for Save the Childrenâ€™s programs. This is a non-political and non-sectarian club. We believe that every child should get a chance at a proper life and will do our part to make that happen.

title: Schar Undergraduate Student Organization
desc: The mission of the Schar Undergraduate Student Organization is to further the state of political analysis in challenging problems concerning the United States and international states. Our student members are dedicated to bringing student representation to departmental discussion and to facilitating professional relationships between students, professors and alumni.

title: School of Integrative Studies Peer Ambassadors
desc: The purpose of the organization is to represent George Mason University and its interdisciplinary programs offered through School of Integrative Studies in a responsible, ethical and professional manner. The Peer Ambassadors also serve as a public relations and retention team, while working in direct partnership with School of Integrative Studies personnel.

title: Secular Student Alliance
desc: The mission of the Secular Student Alliance is to organize, unite, educate, and serve students and student communities that promote the ideals of scientific and critical inquiry, democracy, secularism, and human-based ethics. We envision a future in which nontheistic students are respected voices in public discourse and vital partners in the secular movement's charge against irrationality and dogma.

title: SERVE
desc: The purpose of this organization is to share and promote a mother's love to the Mason community while seeking academic excellence. As mothers always give without expecting in return, we shall serve the Mason community through community services, Biblical seminars, random acts of kindness etc. In addition to that, to acquaint students with God's deep mysteries as well as His plan of salvation for mankind done in the flesh (Heb. 9:28).

title: Sigma Alpha Iota - Mu Epsilon
desc: The Mission of Sigma Alpha Iota International Music Fraternity is to encourage, nurture and support the art of music. We also support and promote women in leadership.

title: Sigma Chi
desc: Our mission is to develop values-based leaders committed to the betterment of character, campus, and community.

title: Sigma Gamma Rho Sorority, Incorporated
desc: Sigma Gamma Rho was founded on and continues to be steadfastly committed to the tenets of excellence in Scholarship, Sisterhood and Service.  Sigma Gamma Rho has a proud legacy of providing positive and proactive community leadership and support when and wherever needed as indicated by the sorority's international slogan, "Greater Service, Greater Progress." Sigma Gamma Rho Sorority's aim is to enhance the quality of life within the community. Public service, leadership development and education of youth are the hallmarks of the organization's programs and activities. Sigma Gamma Rho addresses concerns that impact society educationally, civically, and economically.

title: Sigma Phi Epsilon
desc: SigEp is redefining fraternity on college campuses across the country. We complement a man's education by delivering a premier student experience in one of the most formative times of his life. Through SigEp, men strengthen their character, build leadership and interpersonal skills, and learn to develop healthy, lifelong relationships that are essential to a successful and fulfilling life.

title: Sigma Psi Zeta Sorority, Inc.
desc: Sigma Psi Zeta is a progressive, multicultural Greek organization. We are a cultural, social, educational, and community-service oriented sorority. Our organization provides a means to success and support for women, particularly women of color. We strive to empower and serve to advocate for the struggles of women, while celebrating our many cultures and traditions. Our philanthropy is to combat the violence against women.

title: Sikh Student Association
desc: The Sikh Student Association at George Mason University welcomes everyone! George Mason University's Sikh Student Association was established in 2007.
