The organization was created as a platform for Sikh students to come together and get involved in the community and live up to the principles of Sikhism. The purpose of the organization is to promote awareness of our faith, heritage and culture through understanding and service within the community. The Sikh Student Association serves as a forum and support group for students, faculty and those interested in increasing awareness of the Sikh faith and getting involved in humanitarian efforts through seva.

title: Social Action and Integrative Learning
desc: SAIL (Social Action & Integrative Learning), housed within the School of Integrative Studies, is an evolving community of Mason students, faculty, administrators, alumni, and community partners who are active and passionate collaborators in effecting positive social change. SAIL fosters integrative, innovative, and experiential learning opportunities on campus, regionally, and globally that educate and activate towards a more equitable, just, nonviolent, and sustainable world. We partner with people, organizations, and communities to increase collaborators’ capacity for community-driven social change and to develop and enact creative solutions to complex shared public problems. Our shared work covers many contexts, including:–Alternative Breaks–Civic Engagement–Community-Based Learning / Service-Learning–Field Studies–Leadership & Community Engagement LLC–Mason Engage (faculty development)–Non-Profit Studies–Leadership Studies–Undergraduate Research

title: Social Workers at Mason
desc: We, the members of the Social Workers at Mason, are established for the purpose of supporting the social work student body at George Mason University, as well as philanthropic service to the community at large.

title: Society for Industrial and Applied Mathematics
desc: GMU SIAM is a student chapter of the Society for Industrial and Applied Mathematics ("SIAM"). SIAM is a non-profit, international professional organization engaged, among other things, in i) furthering the application of mathematics to industry and science; ii) promoting basic research in mathematics leading to new methods and techniques useful to industry and science; and iii) providing media for the exchange of information and ideas between mathematics and other technical and scientific personnel.

title: Society for the Advancement of Chicanos/Hispanics and Native Americans in Science
desc: Our mission is to further the work of, to improve the effectiveness of, and to enhance the public understanding of and appreciation for Chicanos, Latinos, Native Americans, Alaska Natives, Native Hawaiians, and other underrepresented minorities in science. And to promote access for students to find opportunities in research and internship through networking and other resources available through the National organization.

title: Society of American Military Engineers, GMU Student Chapter
desc: SAME-GMU offers professional and personal development, networking, and community involvement to students from all backgrounds in efforts to enhance our country's innovation, infrastructure and national security posture.

title: Society of Hispanic Professional Engineers
desc: SHPE changes lives by empowering the Hispanic community to realize its fullest potential and to impact the world through STEM awareness, access, support and development.

title: Society of Women Engineers
desc: We are the collegiate section at George Mason University of the National Organization, Society of Women Engineers. It is open to all students especially those with a major in a Science, Technology, Engineering, or Math field.The mission of SWE and our chapter is to stimulate women to achieve their full potential in careers as engineers and leaders, expand the image of the engineering profession as a positive force in improving the quality of life, and to demonstrate the value of diversity.

title: Soletap
desc: Our mission is to embrace the art of tap dancing in the George Mason community. Through this experience members will be able to surround themselves with others who share similar passions and interests in tap dancing.

title: Somali Student Association
desc: The Somali Student Association seeks to unite Somalis and non-Somalis by sharing the rich cultural heritage, traditions, and history of the Somali people with the George Mason University community. To promote cultural and social awareness of the Somali people amongst the entire student and faculty at George Mason University. To amend the misconceptions of Somali people, culture, and places. To facilitate better communication and understand between Somali people and all other members of the university community. To promote unity amongst the Somali students at George Mason University and providing a space where they can connect and collaborate on campus.

title: Sports Management Society
desc: Sport Management Society provides a space for students with an interest in different aspects of the sport industry to gather in a fun, social environment. Through study sessions, guest speakers, conference attendance, and social events students will network and learn about various aspects of the sport industry.

title: Student Bible Study
desc: We want to spread out the word of God. The Word of God shall be a beam of heavenly light that casts out all darkness, emptiness and chaos in the lives of people. Student Bible Study focuses on the rigorous study of the scriptures in Bible. We aim at rightly dividing the Word of God according to the Spirit of Truth. Through the study and application of the Word, participants are expected to gain deep and wholistic knowledge of Bible and to build up a personal relationship with God according to the principle of faith, in a way to worship God in spirit and truth.

title: Student Funding Board (SFB)
desc: The SFB of George Mason University is a branch of Student Government and is comprised of appointed Student Government members, as well as representatives from the Registered Student Organization Leadership Team.

title: Student Government
desc: Student Government serves a mission to represent the interests of their student body and aims to use the feedback of their constituents to improve campus life. Through both the creation and continuation of effective student services, the preservation of University traditions and programs, the support and collaborative nature of their relationships with student organizations, University offices, and the surrounding Fairfax community, Student Government strives to be an invaluable resource for all. With composition from both a strong student Senate and Executive branch, the Student Government is an organization that works for advancing and promoting student interests in academic and social life at George Mason University.

title: Student Health Services
desc: Student Health Services provides accessible and affordable health care to all currently enrolled Mason students in a caring and confidential environment. We offer a wide variety of services to keep our community healthy.From diagnosis and treatment of illness and injury, to immunizations and prescriptions, to nutrition counseling and physical exams, Student Health Services is here for Mason students. Call during open hours for appointments.There is no charge to be seen by one of our healthcare providers. There are fees for lab tests, immunizations, medications, supplies, physical exams, procedures, and some office visits.

title: Student Historian Society
desc: The mission of the Student Historian Society is to provide an outlet and community for students on campus who are interested in history. It is a student guided organization that facilitates additional enrichment for its members and associates through open or guided discussions on historical topics, fieldtrips to museums and historical sites, networking with professionals outside of the university to obtain professional advice, internships, and volunteer opportunities.

title: Student Involvement
desc: Student Involvement encourages students and staff to think creatively. We want everyone to contribute ideas and think of new ways they may enhance campus and their experience at Mason. We offer opportunities to put your ideas into action, learn from hands-on experiences, meet new people, develop life-long friendships and gain skills that will help you be ready for wherever your future takes you!

title: Student Media
desc: Student Media is dedicated to providing hands-on, experiential learning opportunities for students who aspire to a career in media production or journalism, as well as those who simply wish to pursue a creative passion or hobby. Our student-run media groups are the voice of Mason’s student body and provide the university community with essential public forums (print, online, radio, and TV) that document campus life, explore new ideas, showcase creativity, and foster scholarship.Whether you become a student editor, submit your original work for publication, or just read/watch/listen as an audience member, Student Media has something for everyone! • Build your resume• Get your work published• Gain hands-on experience in media production• Develop professional and leadership skills• Meet new people and find your niche

title: Student Nurses' Association
desc: To promote development of skills needed to be responsible and accountable members of the nursing profession; to promote community service through organized activities; and to advocate high quality health care.

title: Student Support and Advocacy Center (SSAC)
desc: The Student Support and Advocacy Center is committed to providing an empowering environment for all Mason students to seek support services and to explore healthy life choices. We offer educational programming, one-on-one consultations, and resources in the areas of interpersonal violence, personal wellness, and alcohol and drug use. We assist students encountering barriers to personal success.

title: Student to Campus Resources Consortium
desc: The purpose of this organization is to act as a bridge between the various departments on campus, the resources they offer, and the student body to further improve the connection and promotion between the two parties.

title: Student-Run Computing and Tech
desc: The main goal of SRCT is to provide interested and motivated students with the resources to begin, develop, and release projects and services that will benefit the Mason community at large. Students will gain real-world development experience and make meaningful connections with mentors and friends of similar interests.

title: Students Against Israeli Apartheid
desc: To raise awareness amongst students as to how they can be part of the global struggle against Israeli Apartheid, particularly on campus and in their own communities. To raise awareness around the continuing Apartheid practices carried out by the State of Israel against its citizens and Palestinian citizens of Israel, those living under illegal occupation, and refugees. To mobilize the wider George Mason community to fully participate in the international campaign for Boycotts, Divestments, and Sanctions against Israeli Apartheid. SAIA is a diverse group of students, faculty, staff, and community members at George Mason University. Our group is organized according to democratic principles in order to promote justice, human rights, liberation, and self-determination for the Palestinian People.

title: Students Demand Action- GMU
desc: This branch of Students Demand Action was founded to address the need for gun legislation prevention measures. We effectively lobby and volunteer to meet this goal. The George Mason branch is not official nor does it directly reflect Everytown's views.

title: Students for Sensible Drug Policy
desc: At its heart, SSDP is a grassroots organization, led by a student-run Board of Directors. We create change by bringing young people together and creating safe spaces for students of all political and ideological stripes to have honest conversations about drugs and drug policy.

title: Students Helping Honduras
desc: Our mission is to alleviate extreme poverty and gang violence through education and youth empowerment. In fundraising for the creation of schools in Honduras, we also seek to spread awareness of the social, political, and economic problems that Central America faces in the 21st century.

title: Students in Neuroscience
desc: The mission of our student organization is to foster the sharing of knowledge within neuroscience and psychology. Our organization hopes to promote collaboration among undergraduate and graduate students pursuing these fields.

title: Sudanese Student Association
desc: The Sudanese Student Association aims to bring the GMU community together by celebrating our Sudanese culture, history, and current events while also being informative. We are dedicated to creating an inclusive and comfortable environment for all GMU students.

title: Tabletop Role Playing Game Club
desc: The Tabletop Role Playing Game Club at George Mason University aims to act as a means for all of those interested in playing, running, or learning about any table-top role playing games. Members will be able to utilize the club's online community to find or form a group for any type of tabletop role playing game, as well as socialize with other members. Members are encouraged to write creative content during their gameplay, players will write creative backstories and game masters will build entire worlds. The TTRPG Club is meant to be a fun and exciting way to meet people and enjoy playing a game in a judgement free environment.

title: Taiwanese Student Association
desc: The Taiwanese Student Association at George Mason University is a student-led organization. Our mission is to promote the Taiwanese culture while building a positive community, and to provide support to incoming students.

title: Tau Sigma Beta Nu
desc: Tau Sigma is an honor society for transfer students achieving 3.5 GPA or higher during their first term at GMU. We work to spotlight the academic excellence of transfer students while also supporting them as they transition into the greater GMU community.

title: TEDxGeorgeMasonU
desc: In the spirit of ideas worth spreading, TED has created a program called TEDx. TEDx is a program of local, self-organized events that bring people together to share a TED-like experience. Our event is called TEDxGeorgeMasonU, where x = independently organized TED event. At our TEDxGeorgeMasonU event, TEDTalks video and live speakers will combine to spark deep discussion and connection in a small group. The TED Conference provides general guidance for the TEDx program, but individual TEDx events, including ours, are self-organized. Click here to learn more about TED, TEDx Events, and TEDxGeorgeMasonU!

title: Thai Student Association of George Mason University
desc: 1. To unite the students within the University by encouraging interactions and awareness between the cultural aspects of Thailand and the United States of America.2. To cooperate with the local American and Thai community by organizing community service projects.3. To develop and preserve the ties between the Thai community and the George Mason community.4. To stress the importance of cultural and traditional continuity in Thai-Americans.5. To provide support in cultural and social adaptation to incoming and currently enrolled George Mason students of Thai ethnicity.6. To supplement the diversity and distinctiveness of the University's population

title: The Águilas Mentoring Program
desc: The Aguilas program was created to provide freshmen, sophomores and transfer students with a strong academic and professional network of upperclassmen. AMP assists students in transitioning successfully to George Mason and to the professional world by fostering leadership and academic excellence through various programs and services.

title: The Alexander Hamilton Society
desc: The Alexander Hamilton Society (AHS) is an independent, non-partisan, not-for-profit, membership organization dedicated to promoting constructive debate on basic principles and contemporary issues in foreign, economic, and national security policy.

title: The Anthropology Club at George Mason
desc: The mission of this club is to enrich the George Mason Community by hosting events, films, researchers, speakers and performers that embrace diversity, support multiculturalism and global perspectives, and encourage cross-cultural learning in a manner that will contribute to the global world within George Mason Community. Additionally, the club will support the academic work of the Anthropology program at George Mason University by holding informal meetings for prospective anthropology majors and minors, presenting opportunities for students to attend anthropological conferences and meetings, and serving as a resource and an organizational structure for anthropology students and all other students who are interested in cross-cultural experimental learning. As a student organization affiliated with the Sociology and Anthropology Department, the Anthropology Club of George Mason is also an affiliated member of the American Anthropology Association.

title: The Black Mambas
desc: Our mission is to share African culture through dance

title: The Campers, Korean Campus Ministry
desc: The purpose of this organization shall be to gather Korean-American and Korean International undergraduate students to create sense of belongings on campus through fellowship and worship, based on evangelism.

title: The Economics Society
desc: "The purpose of this organization is to facilitate discussions of economic ideas, promote a sense of community among economics students, provide assistance and guidance to economics students, and organize economics-related events. "

title: The Future is Female
desc: The purpose of this organization is to create a comfortable and fun space for women of all different backgrounds to empowered and inspired. This organization will consist of interactive discussions for women to be able to create friendships in and outside of their fields. The goal is to create even stronger women that can help each other and their community. We will have donation drives, volunteer opportunities, as well as seminars. The F.I.F will be a place where the word feminist will proudly be spoken. This club is welcome to all, the overall mission is to create a strong community at George Mason and help fight for rights for all.

title: The Gathering
desc: The Gathering is a movement inspiring college students to live for what matters most. We exist so that students in Northern Virginia can know God, find freedom and make a difference in their world.

title: The Impact Movement at Mason
desc: The Impact Movement at Mason is a campus ministry designed to offer fellowship and spiritual growth to black, African, and African-American Christians.

title: The Latter-Day Saint Student Association
desc: The Latter-Day Saints Student Association (LDSSA) is offering a Gospel Study / Institute of Religion class meetings on campus open to all student and those who wish to learn more about God and Jesus Christ, seek to study the scriptures, the Bible, and the Book of Mormon, and gain a greater understanding and appreciation of the principles and doctrine within the scriptures.Free lunch is provided each week (deli meat sandwiches, chips, juice) by the instructor.

title: The Mural Brigade
desc: The Mural Brigade's mission is to make Mason's Northern Virginia campuses more beautiful with different types of public art. Through the addition of public art, we hope to foster a sense of community and expand awareness about various social issues and perspectives. We also hope to make Mason a destination for public art festivals for years to come. While achieving our primary mission, we also give our members opportunities to expand their professional and social networks, as well as offer experience and skills in grant writing, event planning, marketing, painting, and fundraising, that can be added to their resume.

title: The Photography Club
desc: The purpose of this organization is to capture and highlight different aspects of photography through advocacy, collaboration, and creativity within the George Mason community. Also to encourage the sharing of various styles, and present artworks in order to increase networking and provide a productive environment. The organization will consist of meetings, photo critique days, demos, and presentations which will help the club as a whole to improve and interact with each other.

title: The Salvation Army Student Movement
desc: To allow college students the opportunity to serve their loving community.

title: The Society for Collegiate Leadership & Achievement
desc: The purpose of the Society is to honor undergraduate students achievement and empower them by providing powerful tools for academic and professional success. Our goal is to maximize each student's potential by providing meaningful connections to a vibrant peer and mentor community as well as a proprietary platform for developing necessary personal and academic skills. We aim to inspire members to take control of their own futures, move toward independence, and ultimately establish a foundation and foothold for successful careers and lives

title: The Society of Omega Phi Lambda
desc: The mission of the Society of Omega Phi Lambda is to provide opportunity and service to the ambitious, the determined, and the innovators of our generation and future generations through the unification of mission-oriented individuals of all majors in the willing and participatory pursuit of maturing and investing in the minds and characters that comprise and propel forward the future of government and civil society. The Society of Omega Phi Lambda seeks to cultivate a comprehensive and supportive apparatus for the culmination of future prominent leaders in crucial and strategic echelons of society to produce a productive and prosperous social contract with other members of the society. Through the production of a vibrant network, members of the society of Omega Phi Lambda seeks to implement a return of salubrious social interactions that produce communal development, intellectual stimulation, academic achievement, and professional reward, of which contributes to greater communal and societal elevation, mobilization, and productivity.

title: The Square and Compass Club
desc: The Patriot Square and Compass Club serves to educate interested students, faculty, and staff at George Mason University about Freemasonry with the assistance of the brethren from The Patriot Lodge #1957 and other lodges in Virginia's 4th Masonic District. Covering a large variety of topics, the Square and Compass Club will be focused primarily on general education of Freemasonry and is open to everyone!

title: The Student Association of the School for Conflict Analysis and Resolution
desc: The Student Association is established for the expressed purpose of advocacy, community, and strategic communication. The Student Association: as advocates for S-CAR students, facilitates and amplifies student voices enhancing the quality of education and resources at S-CAR and GMU; as a locus of S-CAR students, promotes academic, professional, and social community enrichment; as a forum for S-CAR students, engages in strategic communications to address and provide open lines of communication around common interests, issues, and concerns.

title: The Writer's Guild
desc: The Writer's Guild seeks to foster a love of writing and storytelling. By providing a safe, casual environment for writers and artists, they can share their work, receive feedback, or simply discuss what interests them.

title: Theta Chi Fraternity
desc: Theta Chi was created for the mutual benefit and assistance of its members; the creation of closer bonds of brotherhood among its members; the promotion of the ideals of Truth, Temperance and Tolerance; and the extension of An Assisting Hand.

title: Theta Tau Professional Engineering Fraternity
desc: The Purpose of Theta Tau is to develop and maintain a high standard of professional interest among its members, and to unite them in a strong bond of fraternal fellowship.

title: Transparent GMU
desc: The purpose of Transparent GMU is to provide a platform for students to advocate for more open and accessible dialogue with other stakeholders at the university, including faculty, staff and administration. As an organization, we will provide a platform for students to be involved in important relationship-building activities on and off-campus that are necessary for building advocacy skills, conduct research on the platforms that students, faculty and staff are provided at other universities to have their voices heard, and work alongside administration to implement such strategies at George Mason University. This will ultimately lead to a more transparent university that welcomes diversity of thought and prioritizes the concerns of students, faculty, and staff.

title: TreatYoSelf
desc: TreatYoSelf Mason is an organization dedicated to holistic beauty, promoting a healthy mindset through gaining self-esteem & freedom of self-expression. We are a group that encourages others to become the best version of themselves through altruism, stress management, and fun! We want to teach others how to live life with a positive outlook.

title: Tu Bhi Nachle
desc: TBN is an organization that organizes an annual national collegiate dance competition at Mason during the Spring semester. Our mission is to raise money for a NPO by bringing together collegiate Classical and Bollywood Fusion dance teams from around the nation for a friendly competition weekend here at George Mason University. This will be an opportunity for the whole community to come together and enjoy performances put on by teams from around the country for a wonderful cause.

title: Turkic Student Association of George Mason University
desc: Our Mission is to advocate for Turkish and Central Asian Culture. We will accomplish this through events, club meetings, and working with the Mason the community.

title: Turkish Culture Club
desc: The mission of the group is to promote Turkey, Turkish culture and foster communication and unity among the Turkish people and the people who are interested in Turkish culture. Seminars, lectures, festivals, dinners, art performances, trips are some of these activities through which we seek to interact with members of diverse groups and share and appreciate our common values.

title: Turning Point USA at GMU
desc: Educate students on free markets, fiscal responsibility, and limited government.

title: Undergraduate English Society
desc: The Undergraduate English Society is committed to the personal, professional, and academic development of all students interested in the study of English. By organizing lectures, discussion sessions, and other interactions between English majors and English department faculty, we hope to meet the unique goals and desires of our members.

title: Underwater Hockey
desc: Our purpose is to provide the students of George Mason University with the opportunity to learn about and play Underwater Hockey. We strive to share our passion for the sport with all members of our community here at Mason.

title: UNICEF at George Mason
desc: The UNICEF Campus Initiative is a coalition of student-led clubs on college campuses that partner with UNICEF to educate, advocate, and fundraise and in support of UNICEF's lifesaving work for children around the world.

title: United Mission for Relief and Development
desc: The purpose of this organization is to implement targeted, cost-effective relief and development programs that improve lives. Also to provide students an outlet for giving, community service, and a global impact on poverty. UMR also wants to raise awareness and support for victims of poverty, catastrophe, and disasters, natural or man-made. We promote, encourage and foster collaboration between similar organizations, student government, and other on-campus and community organizations

title: United2Heal
desc: United2Heal is 501(c)3 non-profit humanitarian aid organization that collects surplus medical supplies and sends them to areas in need around the world. We believe that the lack of medical supplies should never restrict someone's access to proper healthcare. Our hope is that by opening chapters in universities across the United States, we will create enough collection/ redistribution centers to account for excess medical supplies in the country.

title: University Bible Fellowship
desc: The University Bible Fellowship (UBF) is a mainline evangelical church dedicated to the task of campus evangelism. Our main work is helping students to study the Bible and live according to its teachings.

title: University Life
desc: University Life engages students in educationally purposeful experiences resulting in student learning and development, academic success, and degree completion.

title: University Parents
desc: We want to get more student parents involve with mason. We understand that they are busy with all the responsibilities that they have but we want them involve. We want to give them information of any kind of sources that it might help them.

title: Upper Division Business and Entrepreneurship LLC
Upper Level VSE LLC
desc: To provide students a chance to receive academic, professional, and personal support from faculty, student leaders, and other students through the development of a close-knit community.

title: Urbanknowlogy 101
desc: We are a group of dancers who strive for excellence and contribute to the community through the knowledge and study of urban movement; which is Hip-Hop.

title: Vegan Society at George Mason University
desc: The mission of the Vegan Society at GMU is to provide resources for people interested in a vegan lifestyle, to raise awareness at GMU about the environmental, ethical, and health implications of veganism, to create a social network for people interested in veganism, and to work on expanding vegan food options available at and around GMU.

title: Vietnamese Student Organization
desc: The George Mason University's Vietnamese Student Association aims to promote Vietnamese and Vietnamese American culture. We also serve our members, the Vietnamese community, and the Asian American community through our four pillars: family, culture, diversity, and philanthropy. We host events that promote and educate on our culture, as well as provide a social structure for our members.

title: Virginia onAir
desc: Virginia onAir is about elections and governance, specifically focusing on how decisions are made and how we are Virginian students and residents can influence those decisions.

title: Virginia Water Environmental Association
desc: Our mission is to compete in VWEA competitions and to help engineers interested in water or environmental engineering

title: Virginia21
desc: Virginia21 is a non-partisan organization that works to ensure that that the voice of our generation is heard on the local, state, and national level. The purpose of this organization is to promote awareness throughout the Commonwealth of Virginia and the City of Fairfax on student issues including, but not limited to, general state funding, the in-state to out-of-state student ratio, financial aid, and state support for research. Virginia21 at GMU will be apart of a statewide coalition of students from over 10 other public universities, advocating together for student issues. In addition, Virginia21 at GMU will represent students in Richmond on Virginia 21's annual lobbying day.

title: Visually Impaired Patriots
desc: Visually Impaired Patriots exist to foster a sense of unity among students with vision impairments, to advocate for the needs of the visually impaired community, and educate members of the George Mason University community about vision impairments. By joining this organization, students will be able to connect with each other and vision impairment organizations on a local, state, and national level.

title: Volunteers Around the World
desc: VAW Medical Outreach provides volunteers with an opportunity to shadow medical professionals and work side by side with experienced doctors. Volunteers will accumulate medicines prior to the trip to the host country. While in country, volunteers will shadow and assist the doctors, perform triage, measure vital statistics, manage the pharmacy and teach public health classes, all under the direct supervision of experienced, local doctors

title: Volunteers Around the World- Dental Outreach
desc: VAW-Dental outreach provides volunteers with the opportunity to shadowdental professionals and assist them in procedures such as extractions, cleanings, fillings, radiography, and sealants. Volunteers will fundraise for the supplies and materials used for the procedures prior to the trip abroad. In the clinics, volunteers will perform basic triage, assist the dentists, and manage the pharmacy, as well as teach oral hygiene classes in elementary schools. All volunteer work is under the direct supervision of a licensed dentist.

title: Warhammer Club At George Mason University
desc: The Warhammer Game Club at George Mason University seeks to aggregate all those interested in Warhammer Fantasy, Age of Sigmar, 40k, and other table top war gaming systems. This organization seeks to be a means for those interested in table top war gaming to play, learn, and discuss the hobby. Members will be able to use the organization as a network to meet other people with the war gaming hobby to socialize and discuss aspects of the hobby. The WHC club is meant to be a way for those interested in the hobby of war gaming to learn more, or for those already experienced to find more people to interact with.Join the official discord at https://discord.gg/4ErXrqg

title: Welcome2Mason
desc: For questions regarding Preamble, please contact New Student and Family Programs at orientu@gmu.eduIf you have any questions about Housing and Move-In, you can email Housing and Residence Life at housing@gmu.eduIf you have any questions about off-campus student requirements, you can check out https://offcampus.gmu.edu

title: Well-Being LLC
desc: A strengths-based, values-guided, well-being focused holistic college experience that includes traditional academic study, experiential learning, personal practices, and opportunities for students to learn about themselves and how they relate to others. Topics include positive psychology, mindfulness, resilience, stress management, compassion, meaning, life purpose, and self-awareness. The LLC explores techniques for managing stress along with increasing mental, emotional, and physical well-being.

title: Well-Being Team
desc: This student-run group represents the university’s strategic goal of becoming a model well-being university that allows all of its members to thrive. The Well-Being Team contributes toward a well-being culture on campus through programming and peer-led workshops

title: Women and Gender Studies
desc: The Women and Gender Studies Center bridges academic coursework with student development, leadership, and coalition building.Our mission is to educate the George Mason University community about gender issues and issues of concern to women, and to be a focal point for women’s studies scholarship and research.

title: Women of Color in STEM
desc: To provide guidance, mentorship, academic and moral support to young women on the collegiate level in order to increase retention of women in color in STEM programs.

title: Women's Club Basketball
desc: As a team, we have a mission of working together to compete and win games. Greater than the mission of winning games we would like to work together to grow as athletes and as people.

title: Women's Club Ice Hockey
desc: Our mission is to provide an opportunity for both new and experienced hockey players to join a team at George Mason. Through this experience, players will be able to build relationships with GMU students, continue their love for the game, and relieve stress.

title: Women's Club Lacrosse
desc: The mission of the lacrosse team is to bring groups of girls to stay fit, have fun, and make friends! We accept girls from different playing levels, hoping we can all come together to reach far into the club standings to win a championship! GO PATS!

title: Women's Club Soccer
desc: We are a competitive travel soccer team in between the level of Varsity and Intramurals. We compete in the D.C area Region 1 Division.

title: Women's E-Learning in Leadership Student Organization
desc: Women's E-Learning in Leadership Student Organization mission is to empower female college students to be leaders by providing them with various opportunities for personal and professional growth. Our motto is to Learn, Lead, Create. We offer networking, leadership, and mentorship opportunities.

title: Women's Rugby Club
desc: The Mason Women's Rugby Club welcomes all GMU women with no experience needed to play. Our mission is to empower women and create an inclusive environment for all to learn and develop their love of rugby.Practices begin August 26th, practice times are Mondays from 5-7pm, and Tuesdays and Thursdays from 7-9pm. All practices will be located at Field 4 at West Campus. No experience needed to play!

title: Women's Volleyball Club
desc: The Women's Volleyball Club team is a competitive volleyball team for experienced players that wish to continue playing volleyball beyond high school. Women's Volleyball Club competes on the state, regional, and national level. All players are welcome to come out to practice with the team throughout the year, even if they cannot commit to traveling to tournaments!

title: Writing and Rhetoric Graduate Student Organization
desc: The Writing and Rhetoric Graduate Student Organization's purpose is to advocate on behalf of PhD graduate students within our current program, provide opportunities for our graduate students to form a learning and social community, showcase the wide variety of interests in the field of Writing and Rhetoric studies to the wider GMU community, and to foster opportunities for professional development

title: X-alt
desc: Our mission is to glorify God with our gifts and talents by spreading His love and the gospel to everyone we encounter on campus and around the world, according to the Great Commission in Matthew 28:18-20 in the Bible. We do this by growing together as a group spiritually as well as musically so we can share the gift of music with others.

title: Young Americans for Freedom
desc: Young America's Foundation is committed to ensuring that increasing numbers of young Americans understand and are inspired by the ideas of individual freedom, a strong national defense, free enterprise, and traditional values.

title: Young Life
desc: Young Life, open to everybody, is a weekly gathering where people come together to have fun, enjoy live music, talk about things that matter, learn about volunteer opportunities, and have a chance to get involved in a community that cares about them.

title: Zeta Phi Beta Sorority, Incorporated
desc: We, a group of college women, do hereby bind ourselves for the purpose of promoting the following causes: of education, by encouraging the highest standards of scholarship; community service, by participating in charitable projects within the community; sisterhood, by fostering the spirit of sisterly love; and the ideal of Finer Womanhood.

title: Zeta Tau Alpha
desc: To make a difference in the lives of our members by developing the potential of each individual through innovative programming, which emphasizes leadership development, service to others, academic achievement and continued personal growth for women, with a commitment to friendship and the future based on the sisterhood, values and traditions of the past.
